race.name: Farmer's Daughter
race.tagline: Rocky bridges and rolling farm gravel through upstate New York countryside.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through NY countryside. Moderate elevation with countryside scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional NY event. Rolling terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Farmer's Daughter is a regional event in New York—rolling terrain with moderate elevation. The NY countryside is nice, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. New York provides good access.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional NY gravel race with rolling terrain. Worth it for NY/Northeast cyclists. Not a destination race for national travelers.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in NY/Northeast and want a local event—yes, it's solid. If you're from out of region—there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better NY events: Dirty Hector (NY State Championship). For similar regional events: other Northeast gravel races.

logistics.food: NY has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: NY rolling countryside requires sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: Start and finish at 182 Hudson Place in Chatham keeps it simple, with motorcycle support providing spare tires throughout the course. Field sizes vary dramatically - sportsfan42069 reported "1200 people over 3 waves" while Cullen MacDonald noted 482 registrants in 2019, suggesting inconsistent capacity management.

length.explanation: Distance varies by source (62-68 miles) but consistently lands in gravel's sweet spot. Jason Gonzalez on his fatbike "wanted to quit at 45 miles in, but stayed the course," while sportsfan42069 noted feeling less sore than after his ultras, suggesting the distance challenges without destroying. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Mix of gravel roads, pavement, and technical singletrack creates bottlenecks. sportsfan42069 described "a section of singletrack that was so technical it was a Conga line of people walking their bikes. After what must have been 10 minutes we were through the thick of it." Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 6,000-7,000 feet of climbing over 65 miles with grades hitting 20%. Jason Gonzalez detailed "15 climbs each varying between .5 mile to 4 miles with grades starting at 5% and going up to 17%," including "one 4 mile climb from 6%-, 17% gradients." Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 70°F and lows of 52°F, with a 43% chance of rain on any given day, and gusts reaching 27 mph. Mid-May weather ranges from challenging to ideal. Cullen MacDonald experienced "hottest days so far this year" with conditions "from outright soup to bright sun," while another rider needed medical attention on "the first hot day of the year in NYC." Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Chatham, NY sits under 500 feet elevation with no meaningful altitude gained on course. Altitude is completely irrelevant for training or race day performance. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Cullen MacDonald crashed when his "35mm Cross Boss tires right in the gap in between the planks" on a wooden bridge, "which promptly flipped me straight over the bars." The course includes "baby rock gardens link rooty switchbacks to just-rideable mud" but stays within supported farm country.

prestige.explanation: Billed as non-competitive but Cullen MacDonald noted it "doesn't feel that way" with the lead group more "aggro racer than we had anticipated." The ambiguous race-versus-ride format and no official finish line or timing chips limit any competitive reputation building.

race_quality.explanation: Strong aid station support - sportsfan42069 praised "awesome" stations with variety, though the middle one "was serving lunch" while another "just had Ice Cream." However, course cutting is tolerated, with some riders skipping sections to manage the difficulty.

experience.explanation: All finishers 21+ get Farmer's Daughter Rye IPA pint, full meal, Belgian beer glass, custom bike name plate, and hat. Barb Blakley Millott summarized: "I loved almost every minute of it" despite crashes and 20% grades on "gorgeous country roads."

community.explanation: Event draws 482-1200 riders depending on year, with strong local charity support for Columbia Land Conservancy and Crellin Park Pump Track. Despite being "billed as non-competitive," the atmosphere creates natural racing dynamics among lead groups while maintaining inclusive aid station culture.

field_depth.explanation: Non-competitive format attracts mixed abilities, from trail runners like sportsfan42069 to elite riders like Cullen MacDonald. The technical sections and steep climbs create natural selection, but the lack of official timing means no competitive field development or depth measurement. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Cullen MacDonald puts it: "In my daze I plopped my 35mm Cross Boss tires right in the gap in between the planks which promptly flipped me straight over the bars, leaving my bike in a bizarre-looking yoga pose with its front whe..."

value.explanation: Substantial finish line package includes custom beer glass, bike name plate, hat, full meal, and local brewery IPA for finishers 21+. Three supported aid stations with diverse food options and motorcycle support with spare tires justify the entry investment.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $75-125. Registration costs remain unlisted across all sources, which typically signals higher-than-advertised pricing. Chatham, NY location during peak May tourism season adds accommodation costs, while the extensive finish line package and multiple aid stations suggest premium pricing structure. Higher total cost than Badlands.

citations.label: reddit.com: Trail Runner Does Gravel Farmers Daughter Race
adkforum.com: 23613 Farmer S Daughter Gravel Grinder

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: Farmer's Daughter gravel race New York

videos.title: 2024 Farmer's Daughter Gravel Grinder - My View
videos.description: We enjoyed this so much last year, we had to come back for 2024. Seemed a little harder. Maybe cause we're a little older? Beautiful day. Well organized event.

videos.title: Our First Gravel Event! | Farmer's Daughter Gravel Grinder 2022 | Chatham, NY
videos.description:
We finally toed the starting line of our first ever bike event; the Farmer's Daughter Gravel Grinder in Chatham, NY! We didn't know what to expect being new to this, so we took it easy to enjoy the experience. This was a tough course with beautiful gravel roads, muddy single track, steep climbs, fast descents, and to top it all off- a thunderstorm at the finish line! 

Thank you to all the volunteers at the event. We were warned that the arrows may change, but we didn't see anything that was off based on the directions from our Wahoo. This was such a fun event and would definitely return next year!

If you like this video, don't forget to give it a thumbs up and subscribe to the channel for more tips, reviews, vlogs, and more!

See you next week!

***********
Bikes in this video:
Road bike: Men's/Women's Fezzari Empire SL Pro Race
Mountain bike: Marin Wildcat Trail 5, Grand Canyon by Canyon
Gravel bike: Lauf Anywhere
Indoor: Wahoo Kickr

***********
Follow us on Strava for more insight on our training:
https://www.strava.com/athletes/joy_pires
https://www.strava.com/athletes/jason_pires

ages, older men and women who were
hauling their ass up those climbs,
particularly this nice woman who rode
with us at the end. These are the real
winners. They inspired us to get up in
the morning, put in the work, don't
complain, and just get it done.
Thank you for watching this video. If
you rode this event, please share your
experience in the comments. If you
didn't and want to, just do it. It's
going to be brutal. It's going to be
challenging.
And there are no rainbows and unicorns
at the end. What you get is a huge
[music] sense of satisfaction that you
accomplished a feat not many people can
say they've done.
See you guys in the next [music] video.
Don't forget to enjoy your rides.
Heat. Heat. [music]
videos.curation_reason: Comprehensive first-person race recap with detailed course conditions and weather challenges over nearly 47 minutes of content.

videos.title: Farmer's Daughter 2025 Gravel Event
videos.description: A gravel event in NY. It's about 65 miles with 7000ft of climbing. Mostly gravel with two trail sections.
videos.transcript:
[Music]
Hey, hey, hey. Heat. Heat.
Heat. Heat.
But we're losing
fun.
Heat.
Heat. Heat. Heat.
We are in your
head. But we're fine.

videos.title: My Favorite Gravel Bike Event
videos.description:
The Farmers Daughter is my favorite New York gravel bike event 
I've done this ride on a gravel bike 4 times so I thought I'd mix it up and take the hardtail. It was significantly harder on the mountain bike.
GX, X01, XX1 channel members have access to early uploads, and extended cuts: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHRUAMAzVUS_Szvxn55GXaQ/join
Bike: https://youtu.be/fWEij8xq36w
Cyclists: Alex: https://www.instagram.com/atb.media, Jacob: https://www.instagram.com/crop.t0p, Geoff: https://www.instagram.com/geoffbest, Andrii: https://www.instagram.com/andrii_does_things
Special Guests:  @ultraromance   @affinitycycles1   @jhuba1  and all the other kind souls I forgot to mention along the way.
Route: https://www.strava.com/activities/9115682971
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TWITCH  ►► https://www.twitch.tv/terrybarentsen
INSTAGRAM  ►► https://www.instagram.com/terrybarentsen
STRAVA  ►► https://www.strava.com/athletes/424534
AMAZON STORE ►► https://www.amazon.com/shop/terrybarentsen
MERCH ►► http://www.terrybarentsen.com
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thank You For Watching!
#TerryBarentsen #cycling #gravel

videos.curation_reason: High-view first-person race experience from experienced participant who calls this their favorite NY gravel event.

videos.title: 08 15 2021 Farmer's Daughter Gravel Grinder with John and Joe

quotes.text: This was a tough course with beautiful gravel roads, muddy single track, steep climbs, fast descents, and to top it all off- a thunderstorm at the finish line!
I'm a little nervous about the conditions and just this being the first time that we've ridden with a lot of other cyclists around us. I'm especially nervous about the trail sections.
